item.title: Report E-2024100194
item.description:
Report E-2024100194

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-01
  • City: SELKIRK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/01/2024, at 0823 hours, personnel at the CSXT Selkirk, NY yard reported DOWX 74341, a loaded tank car containing Combustible liquids N.O.S. (Diethylene Glycol Monoethyl Ether), leaking from bottom of the tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Union Carbide, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024-10-01-00216). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found two of the eight bolts bottom outlet mounting flange bolts were less than tool tight. HEPACO inspected the bottom outlet valve to ensure there were no additional defects and secured all of the bolts tool tight to stop the release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative (Bryan Hopkins Ph# 989-636-1483). The car was held out of transportation pending further work and movement to home shop for a certified repair.
